questions.subject: Comfy UI - Fit Size node
questions.question: Explain the purpose of the Fit Size node in Comfy UI.
questions.answer: The Fit Size node automatically adjusts the size of an image to fit within a specified bounding box, making it ideal for copying screengrab content into Comfy UI without worrying about aspect ratios.

questions.subject: Comfy UI - Fit Size From Int node
questions.question: How does the Fit Size From Int node work?
questions.answer: The node scales an image to fit within a given width, height, and maximum size, using basic math to ensure that the output image size is appropriate for Stable Diffusion.

questions.subject: Comfy UI - Fit Size From Image node
questions.question: What does the Fit Size From Image node do differently from the Fit Size From Int node?
questions.answer: The node automatically extracts the width and height of the image and can upscale or downscale the size to fit within a specified maximum size.

questions.subject: Comfy UI - Fit Image And Resize node
questions.question: Explain the functionality of the Fit Image And Resize node.
questions.answer: The node resizes an image to fit within a bounding box and outputs both the resulting image and a latent batch, making it suitable for img2img workflows.

questions.subject: Comfy UI - Load Image And Resize To Fit node
questions.question: How does the Load Image And Resize To Fit node simplify image handling in workflows?
questions.answer: The node combines image handling capabilities into one node, allowing users to easily copy and paste image data without saving images.

questions.subject: Comfy UI - Values section
questions.question: List the input and output values available in the Values section.
questions.answer: The Values section provides inputs for vae, image, max_size, resampling, upscale, batch_size, and add_noise, and outputs latent, image, width, height, aspect ratio, and mask.
